messages.message:
Hey Team,
Is there any way to get INPUT_COL in the Apply Checkpoint.
Something like this -
`fn_context = kwargs.get('_FN_CONTEXT_KEY')`
`REFINER_FNS, err = fn_context.get_by_col_name('REFINER_FNS')`  -> We can access Refiner Fns at Apply checkpoint time
`INPUT_COL, err = fn_context.get_by_col_name('INPUT_COL')`  -> Want to know if we can do something like this

https://solution-eng.aws.sandbox.instabase.com/apps/text-editor/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/instab[â€¦]ples/validations/scripts/custom_validation_fns.py (https://solution-eng.aws.sandbox.instabase.com/apps/text-editor/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/instabase-solutions/pre-built/us-markets/w9/w9_using_dl/samples/validations/scripts/custom_validation_fns.py)

```def get_refiner_fields_dict(kwargs):
  fn_ctx = kwargs.get('_FN_CONTEXT_KEY')
  ibocr , err = fn_ctx.get_by_col_name('INPUT_IBOCR_RECORD')
  refined_phrases , err = ibocr.get_refined_phrases()

  refiner_fields_dict = dict()
  for rp in refined_phrases:
    refiner_fields_dict[rp.get_column_name()] = rp.get_column_value()

  return refiner_fields_dict```
